message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CR

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the application of machine learning in recommender systems. It also involves the development of a new regularizer to improve fairness in the resulting rankings, which falls under the scope of machine learning. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as recommender systems are used to match users to information. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it addresses the fairness risks associated with recommender systems and how to address them. 

It may also fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as recommender systems are often used in social networks to match users to products or information. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as fairness is a crucial aspect of security and privacy in recommender systems.
